website_summaries.verdict: An Amazon top choice at an affordable price. Best suited for lighter jobs.
pros: 19 mm steel frame can hold up to 150 lb
Easy-open design requires no tools and practically no effort
When folded, this hand truck takes up only 2"
Comes in silver, black, and red
Certified frustration-free packing is easy to open
cons: weight maximum is lighter than other hand trucks on our list

customer_reviews.title: I take it everywhere - what a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I could go on and on about how useful this thing is but let me just tell you about its last little triumph when it moved a king size bed in a box (Signature Sleep Contour 8-Inch Mattress, King) into a third story bedroom. The cart was purchased in early 2012 so as of this review it's almost four years old. The only thing I don't like is the way narrow handle doesn't fit my grip but I solved that by spiraling a thick foam twist-tie over the existing foam padding.
customer_reviews.author: Jill B

customer_reviews.title: Get the aluminum one instead.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this instead of the aluminum one all my friends have, thinking maybe it would be a little more durable in the long run. The one I received is different from the photo, and has a weird telescoping tubular component that runs vertically up the center between the legs of the handle and attaches to the heel of the flip down foot. I still cant figure out what purpose it serves, and it bent pretty quickly, making it difficult to telescope in either direction. I'm not going to bother to explain it more than that because it's clearly a stupid design, and it doesn't match the photo you see here anyway. My recommendation: Get the aluminum version.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected
customer_reviews.text: I've used it only once since it arrived but what i moved with it was a real test of quality, an old 27" big butt television and we all know how heavy those tv's are. After positioning the television onto the cart, i wheeled that beast out to the curb easily and the cart rolled so smoothly. I was very impressed !! I look forward to using my Magna Cart again when i move.
customer_reviews.author: Franko

customer_reviews.title: Best Ive ever seen or used
customer_reviews.text: The postal delivery lady here put me on to these things. It's perfect for my life. Folds up quickly and stores conveniently almost anywhere. Would easily fit in your car trunk. It weighs around 8 lbs. Very sturdy construction when unfolded. The ad says it will carry 160 lbs. I wouldnt try it. If you need to haul that much, get a bigger and heavier hand truck. Ive hauled 80 lbs several times with no problem. A 100-lb bag of cement didnt cause a problem either,...but my back hated it. You cant go wrong with this, and the price is truly excellent. Buy one.
customer_reviews.author: Ange Purs

customer_reviews.title: I Have Had Over 5 Years And Works GREAT!  A++
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for over 5 years now and use this for a lot of gardening supplies. Heavy pots, bags of soil, bricks, stones, etc. This thing has never broken or failed me. Over the years, I do notice the wheels may not pop out as smoothly as before so I just squirt some WD-40 in where it swivels and all fixed. This is a durable, compact, and light weight cart that can easily hold 100+ pounds. The wheels are rubber and not filled with air, which is great! Nothing to get flat and the rubber holds up better under the weight. Takes small curbs and edges easily and rolls smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: L. J. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Warning DO NOT PURCHASE!!! Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Warning - Do not buy. This broke after the first day of using. Used for moving boxes that weight less that 50 pounds. Hinge system collapsed and the cart is now useless. If it was within the return period, I would have returned. After closer inspection, the materials are of cheap quality. Please note the broken hinge on the back.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lenick

customer_reviews.title: Okay for light moving, but not for really heavy lifting
customer_reviews.text: We bought this cart for our recent move and although it was definitely helpful, it did not seem tall enough or sturdy enough to move heavy furniture. Boxes? Sure, go for it...but I would not put a large oak dresser on it. It could definitely be a way for members of the family who are less strong to help out with moving boxes and could be helpful for smaller project within the house or garden. That being said, if I were moving again, I would spend the extra money to get something that was better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the garden
customer_reviews.text: The Magna Cart is exactly what I wanted - and more. I was searching for a tool for moving potted plants but this was cheaper and more versatile than the ones made specifically for that purpose. This will be handy for moving large rocks, bins of soil etc. It is very compact with a telescoping handle, a base that folds up and wheels that flip inward. The wheels are solid rubber. Even my husband was impressed :-)
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: good little cart
customer_reviews.text: I was and looking for and still am looking for a cart for my grandson's bassoon. I can not find a case with wheels on it and the instrument is heavy and really needs something like wheels. This works ok but the wheels are behind the case instead of underneath it so it makes it a little harder to maneuver than I hoped. It works a lot better than having to carry the bassoon on his back though. This would be a good little cart for about anything else that you wanted to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Torg 1

customer_reviews.title: this is the best thing I have ever puchased
customer_reviews.text: I am a liquor sales rep and there is not a day that goes by that I don't use this. I wish I would have bought one years ago, it would have saved a lot of wear and tear on my back moving heavy bottles of liquor, wine and beer! If you are in my line of work or similar, or any job where you have to move heavy things in and out of your car, or just move heavy things, or even if you don't have a job, or if you're just a human being -- you owe it to yourself to get one of these. And it deserves bonus points for the great pun-y name.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Broke. No customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Item delivered was slightly different than one pictured. The one delivered had an aluminum telescoping center strut. This three piece strut came apart after about 10 uses. Amazon does NOT offer product support for this item... so now I have to work directly with the mfg? Hate this aspect of Amazon. There is little oversight over the pictures of the items sold and zero customer service. The hand cart, when working, folded up and deployed easily. It handled heavy loads well. It was relatively light weight.
customer_reviews.author: kgmc1983

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light use
customer_reviews.text: I bought the silver one with the yellow button. I love how easy it is to use and to fold up for storage. I live in an apartment in a downtown area, so I bought this mostly for retrieving large packages (meal/grocery delivery, etc.) from our mail room up to my unit. It is absolutely perfect for that. I don't think I'd necessarily recommend this model if you're looking for something more heavy-duty, but for a single person moving large packages, it does the trick really well.
customer_reviews.author: Edianter

customer_reviews.title: Big Help, Best purchase this year!
customer_reviews.text: At 85 I was searching around for a cart to help me take out the trash, recyclables and groceries and with the assistance of a couple of plastic milk cases and bungees I can easily and confidently load and handle trips to the dumpster and grocery (especially the heavy ones like laundry, soda, cans, etc). I also use a trash bag liner for home disposables and mandated grocery bags stacked high for both. Although I can fold the cart easily, the groceries turned out to be a smaller problem going from shopping cart to my car trunk, keeping my Magna at home until required. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Francis D. Ripish

customer_reviews.title: I bought this cart to lug around my large amp ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cart to lug around my large amp for the band. The fact that I can carry it, break it down and tuck it behind me while I play is a plus. How the heavy grade molded plastic will hold up in the south Texas heat remains to be seen. I withheld the 5th star for that reason. See you in a year or so for a follow up to this review.
customer_reviews.author: SueP

customer_reviews.title: Very nice heavy duty cart
customer_reviews.text: Very nice heavy duty cart. Not ideal for travel, but perfect for moving heavy items around home. The only negative is loading onto a platform, a vehicle or bus, as the large wheels get trapped on the edge of the platform. Also, you must purchase bungee cords or ties to hold items to cart. Otherwise, the cart is of good quality, and transports a good weight, without a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: CandB M

customer_reviews.title: Handles more than you'd think. Cool design.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to carry a 200 lb fireproof safe from one house to another during my most recent move, and even though it's only rated for 150 lbs it still did the trick. I like the folding design, too. My only criticisms would be that the handle is pretty low to the ground when fully extended - I have to bend over to pull it along, which hurts my back - and the handle mechanism can pinch you to the point of drawing blood if you aren't careful. Otherwise, great little cart.
customer_reviews.author: Danonguitar

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful, folds up like a pancake, longer handle would be nice
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting up and down stairs with 50 or 60 pounds of stuff on it and loading and unloading the van. Large size wheels are quiet enough. I am 5 feet 3 inches tall, and the handle felt short to me. I wonder how a taller person would manage with this. I am very pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: steve-ft-laud

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HAND TRUCK, FOLDS UP AND TAKES UP LITTLE SPACE IN YOUR GARAGE
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight hand truck works great!. Folds up for easy storage. The thing I like most about it is that I can use it easily. I am 5' tall, and most hand trucks are too tall for me. This one is perfect. So far I have not had any problem moving heavy boxes with it. Since the truck itself does not weigh much, it is ideal for a smaller woman as well as the guys.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh A. Delany

customer_reviews.title: Very handy but short handle
customer_reviews.text: We have a larger more heavy duty dolly, but the wheels on it keep going flat when you need to use it. Also, I have an office cart that I use to bring groceries inside. But we needed this for moving things like furniture from room to room. Also, to put in trunk when going to garage sale. You never know what you need to move. It is not meant for heavy duty as it is small and SHORT. I do wish the handle extended further as I am tall and have to bend over to use this. That said, I like it and am glad we got it.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnarino

customer_reviews.title: I love that it folds flat for storage purposes and Im ...
customer_reviews.text: Tis is not what I expected it to be. I was looking for something that would help me move from my second floor walk up and into another. I thought this would have been a bit more durable but this is rally made for small packages,groceries...etc. The base where you put the boxes isn't very long so anything you put on it that extends too far causes it to fall off the side even with the use of bungee cording. I love that it folds flat for storage purposes and Im sure its going to come in handy for smaller things I need to get upstairs as I moved into another second floor walk up.
customer_reviews.author: GN.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect & easy to use for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I am more than happy with this little cart, and it has exceeded my expectations. I have back issues and wanted a way to easily tote things from my car to my front door. This cart folds up so easily, and can support an amazing amount of weight for the size. I especially like that when you push the handle out towards the edge of the platform, it gentle helps offload what you were toting. This folds up nicely and fits in between my fridge & counter space, as well as my car when needed.
customer_reviews.author: natbug80

customer_reviews.title: Best cart ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the single most best purchase I have made on Amazon.com. I LOVE this cart and have used it in multiple moves. It is sturdy, folds up compactly, and is very heavy duty for transporting boxes, bins, pretty much anything you need to move from one place to another. I've had it for over three years and it's been my trusty cart throughout all that time. Many people who see it ask where I got it, because it is so amazing. Price is also very affordable for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a truck driver who needs to bring cases of food to his truck for living on during the month. After years of carrying his stuff I convinced him to buy this. What a total blessing. Worked like a charm to bring 4 cases of water to his truck and cannned goods. Folds up easy and stored nicely without taking up a lot of space. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Webb update

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I was expecting this flimsy foldable dolly, that will not roll straight to save it’s life, but what I got was a sturdy dolly that will not break a sweat carrying it’s 150lbs capacity! It rolls like a dream and straight! It’s non marring wheels worked great on wood floors, carpet, concrete, asphalt and gravel! All in all I am impressed!
customer_reviews.author: soaring falcon

customer_reviews.title: Durable, even in extremes...
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this 5 stars, even though it isn't holding up too well for my purposes. I have put mine through a literal torture test. I work in Afghanistan, and I have to transport tools and equipment, sometimes weighing somewhat over 150 pounds. I also have to drag it through very rugged terrain. This thing should have fallen apart on the first mission or two that I took it on, but it is still holding up under the abuse. If you need a folding cart for normal use, this is your cart. Can't beat it for the price, and WAY more durable than you would expect at that price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Clark

customer_reviews.title: You can think of many uses for this product.  As a PBA Bowler, I want reliability.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this for my 4 ball Storm Bag 5 year warranty. The handles suck and fon’t Hold up. Even though it’s warranted after tgeee handles because I’m bowling about everyday. It just breaks with bearing falling out of handle. The cart I modified to my 4 ball bag and is better than replacing the 4 ball bag. Never breaks anymore. I believe 175 lb capacity. I beat it up and it always looks great an works even better.
customer_reviews.author: stormn1

customer_reviews.title: Very handy, sturdy, compact cart!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cart! Bought one for my son who was traveling a lot and carrying equipment back and forth and he was so happy with it he bought another for his home. So, I bought another one for me and have already used it dozens of times. What a handy, sturdy little cart!! Make life just a little easier. It stores away in only a few inches of space, is easy to carry in the car, and will carry a lot of stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect foldable hand truck for moving.
customer_reviews.text: A must have for any homeowner. We used this to move all of our furniture into small apartment. It was a life saver. The apartment building manager did not have any available hand trucks or carts to lend out. Glad we ordered this from Amazon and it had arrived at the apartment building a day earlier. For the price, it is a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: aloha walker

customer_reviews.title: 5 Star Value
customer_reviews.text: Looks really well made with attention. Put my 55 quart cooler (half full) for a ride around the yard and it was fine. I think with some care this will last. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Easy, sturdy, steady.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this dolly cart. I didn't need it to haul anything heavy, but I wanted the foldaway feature and the nice rubber wheels. I use it to move my dog show items across huge parking lots. My items aren't heavy, but it's very hard to carry everything with a dog on leash in one hand. This cart is perfect - I just bungee all my stuff on - including my folding chair and small cooler and off I go.
customer_reviews.author: Caribou222

customer_reviews.title: Ended up in the garbage after a few light uses
customer_reviews.text: Edit: I bought this cart and used it very sparingly. I think I used it less than 1/2 doezen times over a few months. I used it primarily to transport a SMALL guitar amplifier, 30 pounds at the most. It didn't take long for the wheels to bend in so it wouldn't roll straight. I called the distributor and they told me there was nothing they were willing to do for me. So in the garbage it went. I replaced this cart with one from Harbor Freight Tools. Better and cheaper. MUCH BETTER.
customer_reviews.author: VincentTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: It is not good for stairs
customer_reviews.text: I live in a walk-up building. I bought this for carrying heavy items up/down the stairs. The problem is that the handle is not long enough for using on stairs. It is necessary to crouch (bend) down very low. It is not good for stairs. It's adequate on flat surfaces. It folds away well and does not take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Marquardt

customer_reviews.title: Great little cart.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy little hand cart. I put my 100lb child on it to test it out and wheeled them around the family room very easily. Folds away to a very compact size. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Alan L

customer_reviews.title: Not a good design at all
customer_reviews.text: The biggest flaw on this cart is considering it is not a light-weight cart at all, in fact its quite heavy, it does not extent far enough, which makes many a haul very uncomfortable, It needs to be able to extend out another foot or so in order for your back to straighten up when you haul larger and heavier loads. Not a good design at all....
customer_reviews.author: Otto A. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Great for air travel
customer_reviews.text: Solid cart which folds down small enough to put under the seat. No issues with carry on. We used this cart to carry our toddler's car seat in the airport. I used two heavy duty bungee cords to strap it securely to the cart. I also added a duffel bag to the seat and this thing had no issues with the added weight (about 60 lbs total). The big wheels roll easily over any surface including brick paving and small curbs.
customer_reviews.author: Biglou

customer_reviews.title: Not a heavy weight
customer_reviews.text: The base on this handtruck is too small. Can hardly fit any thing on it. It's somewhat flimsy. I always feel like the base is going to break off from the handle. I rarely use it as most things too heavy for me to carry don't fit on the base and have a tendency to fall off. Sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: eyewonit

customer_reviews.title: Very holy with purchase, works great.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, I used it for a few hours Saturday moving pretty heavy stuff, file boxes and other items. Probably had more than 150 pounds on it several times and it did great. Only negative is it’s a little short when fully extended. I’m 6 foot and could still use it fine though
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Stopped automatically pushing the wheels out as the platform is pushed down
customer_reviews.text: The wheels not only stopped automatically popping out, but it takes some strength and coordination to get the platform down and the wheels out. Unfortunately this happened while I was in the midst of a large issue of another sort, so I didn't bother with a complaint, even though the cart was less than two years old and I hadn't used it nearly as often as I thought I would -- maybe a dozen times?
customer_reviews.author: Mari Ann Shake

customer_reviews.title: Good for most hauling and easy storage
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these in Michigan to use at craft shows. This one is the same price we paid for one 8 years ago but this one is much sturdier and will handle 150 ibs v.s. 75 ibs on the old one.It folds flat and fits easily even in my wife's two seater car.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Mail Carriers!
customer_reviews.text: I am a mailman and I deliver a lot of apartment buildings so I have to carry a lot of mail tubs/packages and it gets really tiring. With the magna cart i’m now able to deliver buildings which would have taken me 2-3 trips (and a lot more energy wasted) in 1 trip. it is very strong, quiet (which is good because I am using it indoors and don’t want to be a bother to the residents) and easy to carry/store. i purchased the red just to have a little color and I love it. i’ll be using this everyday so we will see how it holds up over time, but initially I am in love with it.
customer_reviews.author: itzflip photos

customer_reviews.title: Not what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately did not need to use this in time to return it after I discovered the wheels were too small to go up and over our steps so now I am stuck with a cart that does work for us. It was also hard to close up for storage. My advice is if you buy one, use it right away to be certain it will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super handy and useful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just before I moved to help with moving boxes, etc. It's awesome. I love that it's collapsible so I can keep it in my car for times when I need it. I live in a condo building so it's been super helpful unloading boxes, etc from my car. It's substantial and heavy duty - it was worth it's weight in gold when I had to move a 75" 100lb TV into my condo and was able to do it one handed because I had the magna cart!
customer_reviews.author: Veebling01730

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cart my RC car stuff to the track every weekend, it works well for that. I use it for other stuff I never thought I would use it for. Like 5 gal jugs of water I get at the store every other week. Or when I buy 12 pks of soft drinks on sale, can load a half dozen to cart to the house easy, saves a couple trips. Very light, but plenty sturdy enough for my needs. It was drop shipped overnight to my door, which was a shock. My vendor was C & M Trade.(thumbs up)
customer_reviews.author: GTMan

customer_reviews.title: Both compact and useful.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I've never lived in a place larger than 700 sq ft with limited closet space, so I appreciate it when people design things to be compact. This handcart folds up nicely and fits in a narrow spot next to a shelf in my closet, but unfolds to hold a bunch of stuff (no issue with 4-5 bankers boxes at a time). Total lifesaver during my last move.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Too short for 5'9" ..  can't really use due to out of balance
customer_reviews.text: Since the handle is too short (I am 5'9"), the weight is not leaning on the handle side. This pulls the handle up and makes the wheels run into your legs as you pull. So while using, I have to pull and at the same time, I have to push it down. If you are 5'2", it won't be a problem. It is supposed to carry light loads anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: overall great
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy and very useful little hand cart. I have only used it for one event so far, but I am SO happy that I had it. I had about 80lb of stuff to haul and this performed great. It unfold quickly and easily and folds up just as great. The wheels fold in automatically and everything just clicks together into one slim little package. The wheels seem very sturdy and have a nice rubber wheels. I would have given it 5 stars if the handle was just slightly longer and a bit stronger. I could have used a little more space and strength for another box. Overall great use for trade shows and schlepping stuff around.
customer_reviews.author: Erin F.

customer_reviews.title: durable
customer_reviews.text: durable and actually works far better than i thought when i first got it. it stays outside 99% of the time, helps me move plants around, and/or mulch bags, wood for fireplace. toss in a bunge cord and you are set.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher V. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Makes Moving Easy
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. We have had one for years and used it all the time. So handy to move almost anything. Then we did a move and a friend over-weighted it and broke it. We were so disappointed had to order another one right away. You can't believe how many uses you find for it and it makes it so easy. We had a pellet stove and the bags of pellets weighed 40 lbs. With no effort at all you could move those pellets out of the garage and to the stove. Won't be without one.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Guess

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does its job well
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Easy to use - Very portable - Allows a bungie cord to keep my tool bag on it Cons: - Handle often does not latch in the extended position. I have to jiggle it a bit before it successfully latches - Handle would be better if it could extend another 6-8 inches
customer_reviews.author: BriBones

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS FOR ME!
customer_reviews.text: I am an author and I often setup a vendor table at local events. I used to make several trips from the car to bring in my bag and books. I purchased this Magna Cart, and now I only make ONE trip. I have no problems with it. It's easy to fold and maneuver. It's light weight and fits easily in my trunk. I have NO complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Author Billie Miller

customer_reviews.title: It folds up fairly small and easily fit under the seat (by this I mean we ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to use while flying with a toddler. We strapped his carseat to it and used it to wheel him (and the carseat of course) through the airports. It folds up fairly small and easily fit under the seat (by this I mean we put it in the leg space area/under seat of where his carseat was located. This would have been uncomfortable under your own feet though). My only complaint and reason for 4/5 stars is that I wish the handle extended just a little bit longer, it just short enough to make it awkward to balance without leaning forward a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Zalen

customer_reviews.title: Carries heavy load and then folds flat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to move his stuff in/out of college dorm. Folds flat and is lightweight but carries a heavy load. We carried 2 rubbermaid totes and a crate of textbooks in 1 trip. His friends always borrow it
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Basic handcart
customer_reviews.text: It's a portable hand cart, so it can't fail at much. I'm 5'7 and i felt as if the handle fully extended was just too short to be completely comfortable. The weight and size of the device when folded makes it fit very easily into any trunk. The carriage however does seem a bit flimsy. There are not many locations where a bungee cord or strap can be used. Some dedicated hook attachments would have been nice. It kind of works on steps, but not really that well. I wouldn't try toting up a flight or more, but a curb here and there seems fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but some flaws - expected for the size.
customer_reviews.text: 150lb?, seems like a stretch, but it does still hold plenty of weight and still feel sturdy. It also isn't very tall, so if you have something heavy or that sticks out a lot, you have you bend over in order to keep it balanced. Overall it's perfect for my purpose. I keep it in my vehicle to carry demo cases into customers. It folds up compact and is very quick and easy to open and collapse. It's a bit heavy, but that just makes it feel solid.
customer_reviews.author: eejtalk

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for us. I purchased this to carry our Diono Radian car seats through the airport. 2 car seats fit wonderfully and were held on my bungee cords. The cart was more stable, easily collapsed, and easily went through security and fit well in the overhead bin on the plane. I would buy this again a thousand times over. It was a total lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, folds thin!!  Love it!  Went back for a second!
customer_reviews.text: We've used alot of handcarts and like this one the best! Others collapsed (what a mess) but this one is sturdy and we like that the bottom part is flat to the ground so it won't collapse.We bought two!!! They fold quite thin also which is great for putting in the back of the suv and storage! They easily fit a case of water. Perfect for me but my 6' 2" husband wishes the handle extended a bit longer. He has to hunch over to pull.
customer_reviews.author: Me in NC

customer_reviews.title: A great cart to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: I managed to misplace my first one and went right back for another. I do a lot of estate sale and thrift shopping and a lot shipping, and this makes all of it a breeze. I keep it folded in my car all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Tally

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Was just what we were needing to move our daughter into her dorm. We could stack several box on it, wrap a bungy cord around them and off we go. It folds so flat we left it with her so when her dorm room mates go shopping to stock up on water and such they can use it to bring them in easily instead of having to carry those heavy cases of water.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R.

customer_reviews.title: It folds up about 3 inches, wheels come out like a fighter plane.landing.
customer_reviews.text: I carried in my last case of water. I brought in a mason block yesterday thru the house. I am 81. Great quality. Engineering to make this is great.. I have a huge dolly outside but need one for the house. It is hard to lift bulky hard boxes for me to inside house. No more! Wheels large goes right over bumps. What a surprise this is.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Great price, but only for very light loads
customer_reviews.text: The price was right, and even the smaller wheels it has compared to the more expensive models actually work really well. The only downsides are 1) it may have a 150 lb capacity, but you cannot stack the load very high or very deep front to back, due to the physical limitations of the cart, and 2) the handle doesn't stay locked very well in the extended position (it will collapse if you put pressure on it while moving a heavy load).
customer_reviews.author: Del N

customer_reviews.title: Little but Strong
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my needs. I use a wheelchair or scooter and have trouble carrying large or heavy items or packages. This can be pushed or pulled depending on what you need it for. It's lightweight but tough worker. Much better for me to use rather than the larger heavier hand trucks.
customer_reviews.author: Lanore

customer_reviews.title: I tried pulling it up the stairs once with some empty boxes (so not very heavy) and it was not very easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: Helped me move boxes out of a two story building with out an elevator. However, I was going down, and not up. I tried pulling it up the stairs once with some empty boxes (so not very heavy) and it was not very easy to maneuver. It kept getting stuck on the stairs. These are outdoor stairs with ledges due to the lack of a vertical wall and it was very difficult to get the cart around those ledges. With that being said, it probably would work great if the ledges did not exist. Great product but may be better suited for horizontal travel, and not vertical.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: very light and folds up like a precision machine
customer_reviews.text: This little cart is surprisingly well made, very light and folds up like a precision machine. We are using it to transport a trade show demonstration case that weighs in at about 40 pounds. Even though the case has handles and you can carry it like suitcase, this hand truck works perfectly, as that 40 pounds gets pretty heavy if you have to walk any distance at all. We secure the case with some flat, adjustable bungee cords. It is advertised as being able to folds up and store in a plane overhead compartment too and able to haul 150 pounds. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !
customer_reviews.text: Bit heavier than the last one -- but better ! The platform stays down and doesn't fold at inconvenient times. Handle is padded. wheels larger. Weight is still low enough that it can be 'flipped' into vehicle
customer_reviews.author: Desert  Nurse Practitioner

customer_reviews.title: Great cart---if you don't mind buying one every year.
customer_reviews.text: Great cart---if you don't mind buying one every year. I loved this cart because it was very strong, easy to fold up and unfold, and has sturdy wheels. I use it for teaching to carry a heavy bag. After about a year, the unfold mechanism is totally broken. I have to hold the platform while prying the wheels out into place. It is such a pain. So technically it still works, but the ease is completely gone for me. Bummer. For the money I paid, I expected better. I've bought super cheap ($15) carts that worked longer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaF

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This cart is really handy. I bought it to bring a dorm fridge down 4 flights of stairs. It worked great. I like how it folds up too. I do not have a lot of arm strength and when folded I can easily carry. The wide base is great also. The only thing that may concern some is that the handle is a bit short. As a person of short stature, it is no big deal to me, but someone who is tall will have to stoop a bit to use. Not really a big drawback, just might be a bit uncomfortable for them.
customer_reviews.author: MrsFrost

customer_reviews.title: Average Hand Truck
customer_reviews.text: No way this hand truck can handle 150 lbs. in a regular basis. I use it about once a month with a couple of packages of water at a time and it lasted about two years.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Old one was stolen...replaced with a new one...favorite on the market
customer_reviews.text: I had an older one of these for many years. It was typically overloaded, hauling hundreds of trips of Rubbermaid totes with books, etc. Washer and dryer down steps...that sort of load. Across gravel, up and down marina docks. Some of the other manufactures use square tubing, which eventually bends. Folds up nicely. Only down side is if you are not paying attention and extend the handle, you can pinch your fingers...but thats a user error.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Folds easily.
customer_reviews.text: Really comes in handy! This is a nice product! I like that it folds easily and is heavy but not too heavy. I do wish the handle would extend a bit longer, but it's not a deal breaker. I've used it for work to lug boxes of back stock out onto the floor and it worked fine. As long as you don't have too many heavy boxes it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Mom

customer_reviews.title: Magna cart for a reason!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to own a magna cart, I lost it in the gap of parking my car. I’m happy I got magna cart again. I’m much satisfied with the product. It in fact has smoother wheels than the other one.
customer_reviews.author: pavithra venkatesan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect light-duty dolly
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool gadget. It's light and folds to practically nothing so you can take it anywhere. Only concern would be for large/bulky loads it is a little hard to stabilize, but this is an inherent tradeoff for the compact nature of the cart. I didn't buy a cart before because i didn't want to store one, but ket finding a need for something like this. Frankly, I bought it because it was so cheap, but it's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Fuman

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: It carries everything that I put on it But nowhere near 150lbs. I carry 5 gal water bottles on it at 40lbs and it does the job. It appears to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: william taylor

customer_reviews.title: 1st one was fantastic - worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: this is my 2nd one (someone stole 1st one that I had had for 5 years). 1st one was fantastic - worked perfectly. This one ok, but after only 6 months use (carrying small re-cycle bin to the curb) the wheels will not collapse so I have to leave it set-up all the time. If it collapsed as it is supposed to, I would have rated it 5+ stars - it is great for moving heavy boxes/items around the house without messing up the floors, as well as hauling heavy re-cycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: Judith S.

customer_reviews.title: I am 5'6" and it's fine for me
customer_reviews.text: We tour a show to schools and this little guy hauls 2 set pieces (wooden boxes) our costumes and props over curbs, up stairs and anywhere we need to go. It folds so compactly that we can load it into the back of my Subaru along with all of the set, props and costumes. It is true that THE HANDLE IS A LITTLE SHORT when fully extended. I am 5'6" and it's fine for me. Our 2 male,cast members are a little taller and have to stoop a little. But it isn't so much that they mind.
customer_reviews.author: t.

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a job. The job fell through but I still have the hand cart and works great! Wonderful for carting boxes here and there. Well made product!
customer_reviews.author: Beckers

customer_reviews.title: Bent & Broke carrying under 70lbs
customer_reviews.text: Says was supposed to have a max capacity of 150 pounds It literally bent and broke carrying under 70 pounds! It is also super short but I knew that when purchasing What a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Only A Few Times
customer_reviews.text: Used only a few times for a move last month but the spring that holds and releases one of the wheels broke this morning when I tried to move a couple of things on my patio. This broken wheel makes the cart totally useless. I am very disappointed because I read the reviews carefully and chose the model with the fewest negative reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Really like the storage space it save me as well it very nice not to have something so big around the house. My wife used it a few times and she loved it because of it being light weight..
customer_reviews.author: Tito

customer_reviews.title: Great price and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great for moving heavy or bulky packages and folds up in a snap. I bought bungee straps to secure the boxes to the carts. Takes up limited space when storing and price is great.
customer_reviews.author: DCChris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent must have for apartment/condo dwellers!
customer_reviews.text: Compact and durable. This thing is awesome, we live in a condo and sometimes have to move boxes and heavy things long distances from parking to unit. It has held it's own as well as a full size non-folding dolly. I even use this to dolly a 3 person couch around the way and it held up with no damage. Then it folds up into my shoe closet like it's not even there.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: What a terrific hand cart this is. It is solidly built, has a large base good for plants and boxes, fools up into a small space and rolls smoothly. My wife uses it to move large potted plants and carry heavy grocery items into the house like bottled water. Exceeded my expectations. should last a long time, well built.
customer_reviews.author: Thom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my travels
customer_reviews.text: I love the portability, and qualify construction. It fits easily in my baggage prior to boarding my flight. The included straps aren’t really useful when moving larger items. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MARTE

customer_reviews.title: Did the design of this thing is insane I'd buy this thing 7 days a week I'd recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I stepped on a nail half dozen boxes out doesn't boxes out every single month and a lot of them are 50 60 70 lb and it's too much to carry I love everything about this it it folds up it unfolds I mean it's perfect absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.author: Michael A

customer_reviews.title: but solid construction and works pretty well. I am about 6' and the handle ...
customer_reviews.text: Feels a little flimsy when you have a few heavy boxes on it, but solid construction and works pretty well. I am about 6' and the handle was a little too low for me. I had to kind of bend over to push it around which was a little annoying. Other than that it was great to have, made moving things a lot easier. It folds up pretty neatly and doesn't take up much space at all.
customer_reviews.author: hanfamous

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely built
customer_reviews.text: This thing is well built and handles a good load. I looked at a lot of these and glad I purchased this one. I would buy again and suggest to others.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: 4 or 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: They get 5 stars for maneuverability, ease of folding, sturdiness, light weight and it comes fully assembled. It's a little short but that should be known if you read the description.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Y

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Needed a trolley to move around furniture and some other heavy items and this one works great - and folds up flat so I can stash it in the corner. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: WK

customer_reviews.title: A Pleasure
customer_reviews.text: Just like the old “Magna Carta” this hand truck takes the weight off the little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it buy a bigger one
customer_reviews.text: The handle is pretty short so if you try and use this for anything tall it will ding your hand up pretty bad. If I hadn't used it I probably would get a refund because it isn't worth much and doesn't help a lot for moving. But if you are getting it to just move small things around because you are unable to move them by carrying it then this is the dolly for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Great little hand truck
customer_reviews.text: I have one of the first folding hand trucks from about 15 years ago. I bough this one for price and for another vehicle. This thing is so easy and simple to use. A huge improvement over some other designs. Push the button and the handle comes up versus my old one that you had to fold the handle over. Fold the platform down and the wheels pop out automatically. My old one requires you to pop the wheels out first then fold the platform down. It's not heavy duty but for a few boxes and moving stuff around the house or delivering to a building where two trips would be a pain, you can't go wrong at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Walter S. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Extremely short and no support for large planted pots as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This unit is tiny, and at best for child's play. It doesn't and will not fit nor support a planter if larger than 4 inches and it has to be light in weigh. It's also very short, I'm 5'6, the bend over was horrible. It hit right at knees, no support belts, I had to call my hubby in to lift the potted plant vs this. Waste of money. Had I not torn the box open to get it out I would have returned.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I needed this cart for transporting coolers with samples from my car into buyers offices, trade shows, etc. It truly works by pushing a button to unfold and fold back up for storage. I leave it in my trunk all the time and it lays very flat, so much so that I regularly lay things on top of it and it doesn't seem to hurt it. Based on some previous reviews, I did purchase an adjustable bungee cord to use with it, and I recommend you do the same for use for items with a large footprint. The most weight I've used on it has been about 30 lbs. and it handled it with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: KSS 0077

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have on hatchback/SUV
customer_reviews.text: I really didn’t expect much from a collapsible dolly, but this is cleverly built and seems more durable than I expected. So far, so great!
customer_reviews.author: N. Keith

customer_reviews.title: A good compromise for my  purposes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for groceries because we don't have space to store a cart, and because most handcarts are flimsy. This seems durable. Two strong bungees hold 2 layers of paper shopping bags to the truck. However, I also bought a laundry bag to increase capacity and reduce the chance of losing a bag in route home. The handle is too short. It's a little wobbly. But, overall, after two uses, I'm happy with the purchase. I can use it to double for carrying boxes while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Ross, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: As I get older, I find moving objects requires a little assistance. I specifically bought this to move my laundry basket (a 2-1/2 foot high plastic garbage bin) from the back of the house to the front of the house on laundry day. Sometimes the basket would get to heavy/bulky for me to carry and this little hand truck does the job. It's short and narrow enough, that it tucks away behind the laundry basket when not in use. Have also used it outside to haul leaf bags to the street for pickup on garbage day. I'm very happy with it's functionality, it's weight, and it's folding for storage capability.
customer_reviews.author: Just a tsp

customer_reviews.title: Convenient depending on type of use
customer_reviews.text: This would be great to keep in your car to move light boxes / plastic file totes occasionally. Absolutely not heavy duty - we used this for a recent move and I'd say its now on its last leg. However we were moving dressers and heavy boxes with it for two days straight. Being that it collapses would make it great to put in a car. I could see a teacher using this to move school supplies up to the classroom, or anyone that might have to move some boxes from the street up to their apartment/condo. Extremely convenient for the right application.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Makes carrying my display items for selling my memoir a breeze!  My table, book boxes, tent, and everything now is a sooo much easier to handle. Yea!
customer_reviews.author: Shellie Blum

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Cart
customer_reviews.text: I've used these carts in the past. This one seems very robust and sturdy. It isn't as light as some, but I would believe that is how it is made and the materials used. I feel like this one will last very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ameral

customer_reviews.title: This is Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is just what I needed to transport amazon boxes delivered to my mailbox. I highly recommend it. Folds and unfolds with ease and is very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Ann Driver

customer_reviews.title: MEH...
customer_reviews.text: MEH....I should have read the weight requirements better. I wanted to use this for craft shows; hauling my gear from the car and back and the first time I used it, I ended up dumping my crap on the ground. I was so angry! I'm just gonna get a higher weight limit one and use this one around the office for WAY lighter items. Also, the handle could be a little longer etc. I'm 5'4 and have to bend/stoop. This would work great for things around 75lb-100lb
customer_reviews.author: Mioshee Greer

product_meta.title: Magna Cart Ideal 150 lb Capacity Steel Folding Hand Truck
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverMagna Cart (MCI) Ideal Hand Truck 150Lb Capacity Description Rugged like a hand truck yet designed to fold more compactly than most luggage carts, the Magna Cart is a favorite of anyone who regularly hauls gear around. The MCI opens instantly with the touch of a button, and go wherever you need it. The MCI Magna Cart folds to just over 2 inches thick for easy storage. You can use it at home to carry in groceries, at the office to move heavy reams of paper, at the marina to haul your boat provisions, or on an overseas trip to help with multiple pieces of luggage. And when you're done using the MCI, the cart folds to just over 2 inches thick thanks to the retractable wheels. The Magna Cart is so compact that you can easily fit it in a car trunk or a closet. Features Foldable hand truck for moving boxes, luggage, and more Rugged 19mm steel frame holds up to 150 pounds Opens instantly with the touch of a single button Retractable wheels help frame fold to just over 2 inches thick Ships in Certified Frustration-Free Packaging Extends to 39 inches tall Folds to 28 inches tall and 2.5 inches thick 15-inch wide steel base plate Rugged 19mm steel frame with parallel tubes 150-pound capacity Weighs under 9 pounds Handle Type: Continuous flow Foldable: Yes Height (in.): 39 Overall Width (in.): 16 1/2 Toe Plate Depth (in.): 11 1/8 Toe Plate Width (in.): 14 29/32 Adjustable: No Tire Type: Non marking Manufacturer Warranty: 12 months parts / 12 months labor Ship Weight: 9.0 lbs

AMAZON.COM
The Magna Cart™ Ideal. Engineered with toughness in mind…holds up to 150 lbs., but only weighs 9 lbs. Compacted, it measures only 27" tall and 2" wide…great for carrying on planes (fits in overhead compartments as it has fully retractable wheels), trains and automobiles.... and every office or warehouse. It's slim size helps it store anywhere....on a peg hook in your garage or closet, in your trunk, a nook or cranny in your RV...just about anywhere. It extends to 39" tall to confirm to almost any body length comfortably...and the 5" rubber (no air ever needed) rolls on nearly any surface smoothly. 

Certified Frustration-Free Packaging
Amazon.com has certified this product's packaging is Frustration-Free. A Frustration-Free Package is easy-to-open and comes without excess packaging materials such as hard plastic "clamshell" casings, plastic bindings, and wire ties. It is exactly the same as a traditionally packaged product--we've just streamlined the packaging to be opened without the use of a box cutter or knife and will protect your product just as well as traditional packaging during shipping. Products with Frustration-Free Packaging can frequently be shipped in their own boxes, without the need for an additional shipping box. Learn more.
feature_bullets: Foldable hand truck for moving boxes, luggage, and more
Rugged 19mm steel frame holds up to 150 pounds
Opens instantly with the touch of a single button
Retractable wheels help frame fold to just over 2 inches thick

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,010 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
